The team won the 25th Intelligent Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC), which is the world's biggest unmanned ground vehicle competition held at Oakland University, Michigan USA.
description: Another feather to the hat. A big one, this!

alt: The team won the 25th Intelligent Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC), which is the world's biggest unmanned ground vehicle competition held at Oakland University, Michigan USA.

description: The team secured 2nd position Worldwide in the Finals of the ASME-SDC 2013 in Malaysia

alt: Techfest International Robowars, 2015-16
description: The team secured 2nd Position in the International Robowars held at Techfest 2015-16

alt: The winning run of Team Sedrica at IGVC 2017, held at Oakland University in Michigan, USA. The team stood first in the Autonomous Navigation Challenge.
Team Sedrica receiving the Mahindra E2O car for further development and testing as we stood among the top 11 finalists in the Mahindra RISE driverless car challenge.
description: We're in the big leagues now

alt: The team won the Asia Pacific regionals of Student Design Competition (SDC) in 2017 organized by American Society of Mechanical Engineering (ASME) beating all other teams of the Asia Pacific region.
description: We are from IIT Bombay and we have killer instincts.

alt: ASME-SDC 2012, Houston
description: The team stood 2nd in the World Finals of the ASME-SDC held in 2012 at Houston, USA for the Energy relay problem.

alt: The place where history was created by UMIC in 2017. This is the stage for the ASME-SDC World Finals at Tampa Convention Center Florida.
description: The place where dreamers became achievers.

alt: The team won the Student Design Competition - World Finals Pentathlon organised by ASME's International Mechanical Engineering Congress and Exposition that was held in Tampa, Florida, USA on 5th November 2017.
The team won the Asia Pacific regionals of Student Design Competition (SDC) in 2019 organized by American Society of Mechanical Engineering (ASME) beating all teams across the Asia Pacific region.
The freshmen team that participated in the ASME- Student Design Competition 2019 along with their bot 'DEEPU'
description: Too much, too soon? Well that won't stop us, would it now!

alt: Holding the Victory Cup for securing the 1st Position in ASME-SDC Asia Pacifics-2019
Deepu: The one where we won
The calligraphy bot, a device capable of accepting inputs from a computer and writing the specified characters using the exact positioning of the inputs.
Team UMIC's entree to the ASME-SDC 2012, better known as the 'Energy Relay', led the team to victory in the Asia Pacific round
'Remote Inspection Vehicle', the bot that helped us bag 2nd position in the World finals of ASME-SDC 2013 held at USA

The Electric All Terrain Vehicle (EATV): the prototype was designed to demonstrate its usefulness for supplying food packages and other aides to affected areas while also carrying heavy payloads for the army.
BEAST: A bot with pnuematic flippers which participated in International Robowars - Techfest 2015 -16 and stood as the First Runner Up.

Backpack Rover: A remotely operated vehicle designed  specifically for military purposes. A soldier can carry it in his backpack and deploy it to access locations that cannot be visually accessed, and thus avoid unnecessary enemy contact.
description: You can carry me in your Backpack!

description: Are you an obstacle? I'm good at avoiding you.

DEEPU: The bot that led the team to victory in the Asia Pacific round of ASME-Student Design Challenge; Notice the unconventional use of mecanum wheels which allowed the bot to move freely in the arena.

alt: DEEPU: The bot that led the team to victory in the Asia Pacific round of ASME-Student Design Challenge; Notice the storage space for balls as well as the deployable walls for precisely dropping them.
description: What are you waiting for? Let's go and win!
